programme.title: Aus Open Classics: 1981 (W) Final
programme.desc: Australian Open Classics - 1981 Womens Final: Chris Evert vs Martina Navratilova. Martina Navratilova defeated Chris Evert in the final, to win the womens singles title. It was her first title and third major singles title overall.

programme.title: Aus Open Classics: 1993 (W) Final
programme.desc: Australian Open Classics - 1993 Womens Final: Monica Seles vs Steffi Graf. Two-time defending champion Monica Seles defeated Steffi Graf in the final to win the womens singles tennis title. It was Seles third Australian Open title.

programme.title: Aus Open Classics: 2008 (M) Final
programme.desc: Australian Open Classics - 2008 Mens Final: Novak Djokovic vs Jo-Wilfried Tsonga. Novak Djokovic defeated unseeded Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in the final to win the Mens Singles tennis title. It was his first Grand Slam title.

programme.title: Aus Open Classics: 2017 (M) SF
programme.desc: Australian Open Classics - 2017 Mens Semi-final: Roger Federer vs Stan Wawrinka. Roger Federer saw off a comeback from Stan Wawrinka to beat the world No4 and reach his 28th grand slam final.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 13
programme.desc: Stage 13: Rovigo - Vicenza. The stage starts flat, with a short climb at Passo Roverello. Riders then face continuous ups and downs in the Berici Hills, including San Giovanni in Monte, before finishing at Monte Berico.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 14
programme.desc: Stage 14: Treviso - Nova Gorica/Gorizia. Completely flat with some late bumps. Around km 140, the route briefly enters Slovenia before heading to Gorizia and entering the final 14 km circuit, ending in Nova Gorica.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 15
programme.desc: Stage 15: Fiume Veneto - Asiago. This stage consists of a heavy climbing that begins near Bassano del Grappa with two long climbs to the Asiago Plateau.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 17
programme.desc: Stage 17: San Michele allAdige (Fondazione Edmund Mach) - Bormio. A mountainous day with two long central climbs, Passo del Tonale and Passo del Mortirolo from Monno. Near Bormio, the riders also tackle the short climb to Le Motte.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 18
programme.desc: Stage 18: Morbegno - Cesano Maderno. A few early climbs followed by about 60 km of slightly downhill, flat terrain all the way to the finish.

programme.title: World Of Freesports

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 19
programme.desc: Stage 19: Biella - Champoluc. Riders take on Col Tzecore , Col de Saint-Pantaleon, and Col de Joux. After descending to Brusson, the final uphill section begins towards Antagnod.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 20
programme.desc: Stage 20: Verrès - Sestrière (Vialattea). Flat early on to the Canavese area, steep climbs leads to the Lanzo Valleys. Past Viù, the climb to Colle del Lys begins, followed by the brutal ascent of Colle delle Finestre.

programme.title: Giro dItalia 25: Stage 21
programme.desc: Stage 21: Roma - Roma. The final stage is split into two parts, first a ride from Rome-EUR to the coast and Ostia, then back to the start area before the final circuit through the heart of the Eternal City.
